subtitles.subtitle: I am one of the lead developers of
popcorn a JavaScript library that adds
timeline based data to any video.
I am going to show you what popcorn
can do. Right now all you see is me
talking on the screen you can’t really
do anything but watch. Let’s make this
video more exciting. Let me add
some French subtitles. Popcorn uses
Google Translate to translate subtitles
to any language. You might be curious
to know that this video was filmed in
Toronto, Ontario. If you don’t know
exactly where that is feel free to
pause this video and investigate the
map. Popcorn was built by five people,
there they are. We collaborated with
filmmakers and artists to ensure that
popcorn is easy to use. Let me show
you some other cool features. Keep in
mind that you can have any feature
appear and disappear at any time
during the video. Popcorn makes it
possible to pull data from twitter.
Let’s see what people are saying
about popcorn right now.
You can also showcase your work
by pulling data from a flicker account.
Here are some pictures I posted.
If you are not quite sure what
Flicker is take a second to read
about it on Wikipedia. To try
out popcorn visit our homepage,
it is displayed just below me.
